item.title: 美国加征关税前瑞士 7 月钟表出口反弹
item.description: 瑞士钟表出口在上个月急剧下降后，于 7 月份恢复增长，原因是各公司试图在美国提高贸易关税之前增加库存。【原文：Swiss watch exports returned to growth in July after a steep drop the previous month, as companies tried to build up their stock in the US ahead of higher trade tariffs.】

item.title: 土耳其股市将创纪录收盘，押注更多降息举措
item.description: 土耳其股市正朝着历史最高收盘价迈进，因为对通胀下降的预期预示着更多的降息措施。【原文：Turkish stocks are heading for their highest ever close as expectations for a decline in inflation bode well for more interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 瑞士银行家奖金上限提案在议会被淡化
item.description: 瑞士立法者淡化了一项提案，该提案本打算为包括瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）在内的瑞士最大银行设定固定的薪酬上限。【原文：Swiss lawmakers have watered down a proposal that would have installed a fixed upper limit on compensation at the country’s biggest banks including UBS Group AG.】

item.title: 在数十宗大宗交易中，Ola 股价两天内大幅波动
item.description: Ola Electric Mobility Ltd. 的股价在截至周四的两个交易日内大幅波动，交易量激增至创纪录水平，原因是这家印度电动摩托车制造商推动推出新车型和建设电池千兆工厂的举措引起了分析师的关注。【原文：Ola Electric Mobility Ltd.’s shares saw sharp swings over two sessions through Thursday, with trading volumes surging to a record as the Indian e-scooter maker’s push to rollout new models and build a battery cell gigafactory drew analyst attention.】

item.title: 越南加大基础设施投入，越南盾弱势加剧
item.description: 已经创下历史新低的越南盾正面临着越来越大的压力，这些压力来自于政府的基础设施支出狂潮，以及美国贸易政策对出口的打击。【原文：The Vietnamese dong, already at record lows, is facing mounting pressure from the government’s infrastructure spending spree and a hit to exports from US trade policy.】

item.title: Seven & i 的价值被永旺黯然失色，因为改版工作难以给人留下深刻印象
item.description: 在Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.放弃对7-Eleven的收购后，7-Eleven的股价萎靡不振，这是二十年来Seven & i Holdings Co.的市值首次跌破永旺股份有限公司（Aeon Co.【原文：Seven & i Holdings Co.’s market value dipped below Aeon Co. for the first time in two decades, as shares in the operator of 7-Eleven stores languish after Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. abandoned its bid for the company.】

item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Indian stocks are emerging market investors’ biggest underweight market after they accelerated rotation to Asian peers last month, according to Nomura Holdings Inc.】

item.title: 挪威经济增长超预期，减息预期受挫
item.description: 挪威经济出人意料地实现了连续第二个季度的超预期增长，这给挪威央行重新考虑更多宽松计划增加了压力。【原文：Norway’s economy surprised with faster-than-expected growth for a second quarter in a row, adding pressure on the nation’s central bank to reconsider its plans for more easing.】

item.title: 瑞士的规则外交与特朗普的交易策略相冲突
item.description: 长期以来，瑞士一直将其外交技巧作为国家的卖点，如果它想让最近与唐纳德-特朗普的灾难性贸易谈判成为过去，就必须重新思考一些长期坚持的原则。【原文：Switzerland, which has long touted its diplomatic skills as a national selling point, is going to have to rethink some long-held principles if it wants to put its recent disastrous trade negotiations with Donald Trump in the past.】

item.title: 英国赤字缩减，7 月借贷额为三年来最低
item.description: 英国 7 月份的预算赤字有所减少，原因是缴纳自行评估所得税的截止日期提高了国库的收入，使财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）暂时松了一口气。【原文：Britain registered a smaller budget deficit in July as a deadline for paying self-assessed income tax boosted Treasury coffers, bringing temporary relief for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.】

item.title: 肯尼亚计划为更多欧洲债券再融资，重新谈判银行贷款
item.description: 肯尼亚财政部长约翰-姆巴迪（John Mbadi）表示，肯尼亚计划对未来九年到期的几笔欧元债券进行再融资，以帮助分散还款。【原文：Kenya plans to refinance several eurobonds falling due over the next nine years to help spread out repayments, according to Treasury Secretary John Mbadi.】

item.title: 39%关税生效前瑞士对美出口走高
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普出人意料地对瑞士征收 39% 的关税之前，瑞士对美国的出口在 7 月份出现了连续第二个月的增长。【原文：Swiss exports to the US inched up in July, the second straight month of expansion before President Donald Trump unexpectedly slapped a 39% tariff on the country.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将保持在纪录附近
印度与俄罗斯寻求将贸易额增至1000亿美元，与美国的关系出现裂痕
item.description: 一位高级特使表示，印度和俄罗斯希望在未来五年内将两国的年贸易额提高约50%，达到1000亿美元，并在两国与美国的紧张关系日益加剧的情况下寻求降低关税。【原文：India and Russia are looking to increase their annual trade by about 50% over the next five years to reach $100 billion, seeking to reduce tariffs as both countries see mounting tensions with the US, a top envoy said.】

item.title: 亿万富翁安巴尼成为特朗普贸易怒火的附带损害者
item.description: 今年 1 月，印度首富和他的妻子在华盛顿参加了唐纳德-特朗普就职前的晚宴。在信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）分享的一张活动照片中，三人都对着镜头束手就擒。【原文：Back in January, India’s richest man and his wife were in Washington, attending a pre-inauguration dinner thrown for Donald Trump. In a photograph of the event shared by Reliance Industries Ltd., all three beam for the camera.】

item.title: 印度和巴基斯坦季风季节造成至少 1,860 人死亡
item.description: 一个致命的季风季节在印度和巴基斯坦夺走了至少 1860 条生命，山洪暴发、山体滑坡和城市被淹暴露了该地区在与气候有关的灾害面前日益脆弱的脆弱性。【原文：A deadly monsoon season has claimed at least 1,860 lives in India and Pakistan, with flash floods, landslides and inundated cities exposing the region’s growing vulnerability to climate-related disasters.】

item.title: 印度经济活动摆脱关税担忧，PMI快报显示
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的即时调查显示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对印度商品征收 50%的关税，但在强劲的服务业带动下，印度经济在 8 月份依然活跃。【原文：India’s economy buzzed with activity in August, led by a strong services sector, even though the US President Donald Trump imposed a 50% tariff on Indian goods, a flash survey by HSBC Holdings Plc showed.】

item.title: 韩国房地产市场趋于稳定，为韩国央行提供宽松空间
item.description: 在政府采取措施为需求降温后，韩国房地产市场出现了企稳迹象，价格增长逐步放缓，这可能为央行在下周会议上放宽政策提供了空间。【原文：South Korea’s property market showed signs of stabilizing after the government undertook steps to cool demand, with a gradual moderation in price growth that could offer the central bank scope to ease policy at its meeting next week.】

item.title: Insignia 首席执行官对交易充满信心，称 CC Capital 为团队提供支持
item.description: Insignia Financial Ltd.首席执行官斯科特-哈特利（Scott Hartley）表示，相信澳大利亚监管机构会为 CC Capital Partners 提议的 33 亿澳元（21 亿美元）私有化交易铺平道路。【原文：Insignia Financial Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Scott Hartley expressed confidence in Australian regulators to pave the way for CC Capital Partners’ proposed A$3.3 billion ($2.1 billion) take-private deal by early next year.】

item.title: KKR 是以 6.1 亿美元出售日产总部的领跑者
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，KKR & Co.已成为收购日产汽车公司全球总部的主要竞标者，因为这家陷入困境的汽车制造商正在出售资产以支撑其财务状况。【原文：KKR & Co. has emerged as the lead bidder to buy Nissan Motor Co.’s global headquarters, according to people familiar with the matter, as the embattled carmaker sells off assets to shore up its finances.】

item.title: 股市外流导致台币跌至 5 月以来最弱
item.description: 在科技股资金外流的推动下，台币连续第六天下跌，创下 5 月份以来最弱。【原文：The Taiwan dollar fell for a sixth day to its weakest since May, driven by tech-heavy equity outflows.】

item.description: 由于近期本地融资成本飙升，香港股市正面临着又一次冲击。【原文：Hong Kong’s stock market is facing another speed bump from a recent spike in local funding costs.】

item.title: 菲律宾企业监管机构处罚最富有大亨的公司
item.description: 菲律宾证券交易委员会正在对该国首富的一家房地产控股公司进行处罚，原因是该公司未能按要求提交报告，这是该公司与监管机构之间发生的一连串摩擦中的最新一起。【原文：The Philippines’ Securities and Exchange Commission is penalizing a property holding firm of the country’s richest man for failing to submit reportorial requirements, the latest of a string of brushes between the firm and regulators.】

item.title: 花旗任命阿斯加尔-阿里为企业银行房地产业务主管
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份内部备忘录，花旗集团已任命阿斯加尔-阿里（Asghar Ali）为企业银行房地产业务主管，以加强其在该领域的影响力。【原文：Citigroup Inc. has named Asghar Ali as head of corporate banking real estate, as the bank looks to strengthen its presence in the sector, according to a an internal memo seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 一次性吸食器被禁后，英国人扔掉可重复使用的吸食器
item.description: 一项新的研究表明，英国对一次性吸管的禁令未能阻止用户将可充装设备视为可丢弃的产品。【原文：A UK ban on disposable vapes is failing to stop users treating refillable devices as if they are still throwaway products, new research shows.】

item.title: 百度成为中国最便宜的互联网股票，人工智能备受关注
item.description: 由于对前景的担忧，百度公司股价表现不佳，使其成为中国主要互联网公司中估值最便宜的公司。【原文：Sharp stock underperformance for Baidu Inc. on concerns over its outlook have left it trading at the cheapest valuation among China’s major internet firms.】

item.title: 腾讯《Valorant》首次亮相即以 100 万美元的收入荣登 iPhone 排行榜榜首
item.description: 腾讯控股有限公司的《Valorant》本周在移动平台的首次亮相表现强劲，在中国推出的第一天就在 iPhone 上获得了 100 万美元的玩家总支出。【原文：Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s Valorant made a strong debut on mobile this week, earning $1 million in gross player spending on iPhones on its first day out in China.】

item.title: 日本 20 年期政府债券收益率升至 1999 年以来最高点
item.description: 受对财政扩张的持续担忧和主要投资者需求减弱的影响，日本超长期国债收益率攀升至数十年高位。【原文：Yields on Japan’s super-long government bonds climbed to multi-decade highs, driven by persistent concerns over fiscal expansion and fading demand from key investors.】
